metadata.title: CVE-2021-40516 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
WeeChat before 3.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) via a crafted WebSocket frame that trigger an out-of-bounds read inplugins/relay/relay-websocket.c in the Relay plugin.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

weechat - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-core - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-curses - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-guile - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-headless - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-lua - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-perl - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-php - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-plugins - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-python - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-ruby - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
weechat-tcl - 2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: weechat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
